DOC.brief_summary: This pilot study aim identify patient moderate high risk peri-procedural ( type 4 ) myocardial infarction injury undergo elective coronary intervention ( PCI ) measure high sensitivity troponin T , might benefit potent antiplatelet therapy .
DOC.brief_title: Myocardial Injury Type 4 Infarction Following Elective Coronary Artery Stenting
DOC.criteria: Stable unknown coronary artery disease ( CAD ) Elective coronary intervention Minimum age 18 Present acute coronary syndrome ( ACS ) Age 18 Pregnancy Any additional invasive intervention potential myocardial injury Non ACS condition responsible elevation cardiac troponin , acute pulmonary artery embolism , myocarditis tachycardia . Procedure related complication lead troponin elevation ( e.g . coronary dissection )
